content.description: Climb the face past 2 sandy colored stainless bolts to a ledge.  From the ledge, continue climbing past 7 more bolts to two rap anchors located above the edge (slings required).
content.protection: 9 bolts
content.location:
This route is located on the center of the east face of the Centerpiece Area of Hackberry Creek. 

  From the base of Dacite Conspiracy, climb/scramble up along the base of the crag passing a vertical chimney/chute.  Just to the left of this chimney is a line of older coldshut bolts denoting the climb Right On (5.9).  This climb is the next climb on the left of this face with modern, sandy colored stainless bolts and is not listed in the Karabin guide or topo.

content.description: Fun moves on good rock past two bolts on a rounded arete past a bulge to the top.  A shorter route for the area, but more technical than some routes of similar rating (i.e. Smokin' the Toad). I found the crux to be between the the first and second bolts.  Doesn't appear this route gets much traffic due to the bush-wacky approach, even though it is quite close to the creek.
content.protection: Two bolts and small gear to a gear anchor (small to medium pro).  Scramble down the backside.
content.location: Hackberry Creek area. South of the creek and almost directly across the creek from the the pinnacle with the the large roof (where A Dog's Bark and Oh My doG! are located).

content.description: South facing pinnacle in Hackberry Creek area.  A fun, consistent climb with many horizontal seams and bomber pockets. Bolts with quicklinks and leaver biners (leave them there, please).Two ropes to descend.
content.protection: 5 bolts over 130', can supplement with sm-med cams/tricams in horizontal cracks.
content.location: Hackberry creek area, west of the waterfall.  The route goes up the left side of the pinnacle.

content.description: Starts on a dihedral with some choss. About halfway up the tower, make a sketchy traverse left to a chunk of rock that looks like it might fall out. It is solid, after pushing and stomping and resting on it, it didn't budge (though I wouldn't recommend throwing gear in here, hence the PG13). Once you wrap around the corner, it's time to offwidth! Get your first piece of gear as high as possible in there with an extension or else rope drag will be unbearable. It starts pretty big and gets slightly smaller towards the top. Webbing is at the top, seemingly intended for the crack on the other side.
content.protection: A few cams, 0.5-2 will get you through the first half. A BD#6 fits perfect in the bottom of the offwidth, then drop down to 5 then 4 for some comf protection.
content.location: Southwest side (outside) of the small, free-standing pillar in front of psychoactive. The offwidth and heart of the route can be clearly seen standing in the river area and runs from halfway up to the top. It starts in the corner a little towards the right, behind some bushes.

content.description: Can start using trad from down lower than the ledge used for Centerpiece and the unknown 5.10? climb with the new bolts. 8 bolts to 2 shut rap, single line to the ledge, then downclimb.
content.protection: Sport with optional trad start from lower down.
content.location: East facing wall of the buttress that Dacite and Lady in Red are on. Just to the left of the big chimney uphill from Dacite, has the old bolts.

content.description: The crux may be at the 4th bolt. This short but fun climb starts with a crack to a ledge. Climb the arete to a anchor.  This climb shares anchors with Kynykism (shown here in green and labeled "C").
content.protection: Six bolts; the anchors on this route consist of hangers, quick links, and biners; please leave the carabiners in place.
content.location: Creek right.  A beta photo is included.

content.description:
Climb up interesting, moderate cracks to ledge on right with 2 bolt anchor. Belay here (optional) or spiral left up steep face with 4 bolts to top of freestanding pillar. 

  2 single rope raps to the ground (bring webbing).
content.protection: small to med pro, 4 bolts
content.location: Tall pinnacle just right of Smokin the Toad's face. (Start behind a smaller tower)

content.description:
Climb past 4 bolts to ledge, then 6 more bolts up steep face to 2 shut anchor. A bit grainy in places. Incredible views from the top! 

  With a single 70m rope, rap into gully on climbers left.
content.protection: cold shuts
content.location: Up and right of Free Willy. Kind of tricky to get to.

content.description:
This climb has mostly moderate moves (5.7-5.8) with the crux move (5.10) at the roof.  Relatively easy climbing to get established below the roof, a series of crux moves getting over the roof, and then a fun headwall above the roof to the top.   

  There is what appears to be a loose block on the face below the roof, but we were unable to dislodge it; it is fairly solid.  One can step around it.
content.protection:
Standard rack to 3" (small gear on the lower portion of the climb).  Two protection bolts, one on the lower face and one below the roof.  There are two hangers with cord/webbing to rap (from A Dog's Bark).  

  NOTE:  This climb requires a full 60m rope to rap safely to the ground.  

  ALSO NOTE: there is a short section of bad rock below the roof.
content.location: This route is to the right of "A Dog's Bark (The Great Roof)".  Easy to spot (creek left) from almost anywhere in Hackberry creek. An improved trail makes the approach easy.

content.description: Just to the Right of Graphics Bong. Ends at same anchor. Climb Arete and link features for 150 ft to the chains. Great movement and the rock gets better the higher you go.
content.protection: Trad Rack and two ropes for rappel..can clip a few bolts from Graphics Bong
content.location: On the Arete just right of Graphics Bong

content.description: From the gulley climb up a stairway to the first bolt on the east face. Climb past 9 bolts over a bulge at the top to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 9 bolts / 2 anchor bolts
content.location: Up the gulley to the left of Easy Street

content.description: vertical crack next to aint nothin but a thing.
content.protection: standard LDC rack
content.location: On the right side of the face that features Smokin' the Toad and Aint Nothing But a Thing. See the Marty Karabin map for the area.

content.description: Front, east-facing, side of Dacite pillar. Crimpy, vertical, continuous. Route meanders a bit and has some loose rock.
content.protection: 9 bolts to 2 shut rap, a bolt or two beyond to get to the top of the pillar, then rap off Dacite.
content.location: Centerpiece area on the same buttress as Dacite Conspiracy. Start from a ledge as you get to the pillar from the trail leading up from waterfall.

climbs.name: Kynykism
climbs.fa: M. Geninatti, J. Kynyk, L. Arndt, DAS (2009)

content.description: Boulder start (crux) leads to good horizontals.  A nice face climb, this route shares anchors with Recession Arete.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two biner anchor.
content.location: Creek right.  A beta photo of the formation may be found for the climb Recession Arete.

content.description: Moderate trad route between a large protruding rock ~20' up on the right and chimney on the left.
content.protection: Small to medium gear. Two bolt anchor with chain/rap ring. Rappel with one 70m.
content.location: Hackberry Creek Area. Pinnacle left of Smokin the Toad, upstream (west) from the waterfall.

climbs.name: Immoral Incline
climbs.fa: Leo Bunuel, Jeff Giek, Matt Hudson, Jim Acuna, 4/1996

content.description: Fairly sustained face route with the first bolt about 30 feet up.  At the top, move over to the anchor for Free Willy.  The top provides an excellent (but safe) view of the bee metropolis on the next buttress (top of Lady in Red).
content.protection: 9 bolts going to the anchor for Free Willy.  Need maybe 2 pieces of pro for the easy climbing to the first bolt.  The rest is a sport climb.
content.location: North-facing wall on buttress just to the right of Lady in Red.  Free Willy is around the corner to the right.

content.description: The crux may be at the buldge.  This arete climb protects in a vertical crack at the base of the climb and along horizontal cracks all the way up the arete. The climb ends on a ledge.  A single line rap gets you back to the base. PLEASE be careful on the rappel because there is loose rock on the face that you rap down.
content.protection: Single rack to 2 inches.  Anchors with webbing.
content.location: Creek right, about half way up the slope from the creek bottom.  A beta photo is provided.  The formation can be seen from the approach.  There is a pretty good trail that takes you to the climbing from the creek bed.  I Have Faith Too is drawn in Red in the beta photo and labeled "A".

content.description:
Start up broken face past 3 bolts, wandering up past horizontal placements to a 2 bolt anchor on the right. Belay here (optional) or continue up steepening face with 4 bolts and more horizontals to top of freestanding pillar. 

  2 single rope raps down to ground (bring webbing or better yet replace with quicklinks/chain)
content.protection: small cams/nuts up to .75 camalot
content.location: One corridor downstream of Easy Street. Should be easy to spot the webbing (unfortunately).

content.description: Easy chimney that can be protected with med/large cams to 6 bolts on a short face. Some tricky moves, but mostly just a fun diverse climb. 2 shut rap.
content.protection: med/large cams help, though the trad part is about 5.7.
content.location: Centerpiece Area. Up toward Dacite, then head right with Lady in Red on your left. Next spire uphill from that, climb's on the north face.

content.description: Begin on a small ledge with a tree.  Climb face with a vertical seam, pockets and some horizontal cracks past 12 bolts.  First bolt is a little high, can climb straight up to it, or traverse to it from the left, both options have bomber holds, but a fall here could send you down a nasty scree chute.
content.protection: 12 bolts to 2 cold shuts, 1 double-rope rap down.
content.location: Hackberry Creek area, tall buttress approximately 30 feet north of the waterfall. Scramble down the left side of the waterfall. Belay in a gully/ there's tree there you can use as an anchor.

content.description:
Start pitch one on a flake that goes up and diagonally.  Connect more small to medium gear onto a second left leaning flake.  Continue up a vertical crack using medium to large cams and finally traverse left to anchors.  Plenty of room for a large group at this belay station. 

  We started pitch two in the crack left of the anchors.  Marty's paper guide says "straight up" which would be face climbing with some small horizontal cracks as protection.  Take this vertical crack left of a bulge, pass a piton on your left, continue on up past more vertical crack and dihedral climbing until you finally find the anchors.  Some room up here for friends too. 

  See photo for a visual.  Trust me, not the route name... This long multi pitch 5.7 trad climb won't be a disappointment.  One full rack with some stoppers should do it.  Some doubles of small cams is a nicety but not a necessity.  I recommend two 60m single rope raps as the anchors on pitch two consist of an old sling and two pitons that could use replacing.  

  Update:  go to top of formation and do not rap off of pitons mentioned above!  See comments below. 

  Location:  second corridor beyond the waterfall (probably 100 ft beyond it), on the left of the canyon.
Excellent sustained climbing up a pocketed face with seams on a near vertical face.
content.protection: 9 bolts with 2 bolt anchor. A rack of singles to 0.75" and nuts if you really like to sew it up.
content.location: Centerpiece Area of Hackberry Creek, south of the creek and about 30' East of the waterfall. Look for a large cairn from the top of the waterfall.  A pretty good trail with some scrambling will take you to the base. The route starts at a small left facing dihedral-ish type feature formed from some semi-detached blocks.

content.description:
A fun route in the Centerpiece Area of Hackberry Creek.  The route starts out easy and gets progressively more difficult as you ascend.   

  Climb an easy face past 3 bolts to a ledge.  From the ledge, continue climbing past 6 bolts to two anchors with chains.
content.protection: 9 bolts
content.location: This route is up and to the left of Dacite Conspiracy on the east face of the Centerpiece Area.  From the base of Dacite Conspiracy, climb/scramble up along the base of the crag passing a vertical chimney/chute.  Just to the left of this chimney is a line of older coldshut bolts denoting the climb Right On (5.9).  Centerpiece is the next climb on the left of this face with older coldshut bolts (just to the left of a line of modern, sandy colored stainless bolts not listed in the Karabin guide or topo).

content.description: Not sure where the crux is for this route.  I didn't notice one.  This is a compelling line.  Nice climbing inside and outside the wandering crack. Good protection on decent rock.  A bit dirty, but probably because of the low traffic?
content.protection: Standard rack, but perhaps supplement with mid-sized cams.
content.location: Just right (3 meters) of "Smokin the Toad".  Route 45 in marty's pocket guide. Can't miss the nice looking crack.  We used the same top anchors to belay and rap.

content.description: A good route that wanders a bit.  This climb starts under a small roof/ crack.  Two bolts protect the face as you traverse up and left under the big roof.  Turn the corner and lead up and slightly left and then up the face using horizontals for protection to the top.
content.protection: Small to medium cams.  Two protection bolts.  Two hangers on top (for webbing) with a quicklink and rap ring.
content.location: Scramble up the hill to the obvious large roof on the North side of Hackberry creek, up stream from the waterfall.  You can rap the route.

content.description: Hackberry Creek is south of the Road area. The creek runs approximately parallel to the road and eventually joins Devil's Canyon. Routes can be found on both sides of the creek and are a mixture of traditional, mixed, and sport. There is a 40' waterfall a bit more than midway down the creek.  A faint trail south of the waterfall leads up to the Centerpiece Area (routes found here include Centerpiece, Dacite Conspiracy, Lady in Red...).
